Active Reward Vault allows 1 lock only.

timeToMigrateSubtitle2: After that, you will not be able to migrate your DOUGH anymore.

migrateOneLockSubtitle: Single veDOUGH position to ${token} (Require multiple transactions)
smartContractAddressNotAllowed: Smart contract wallets like Argent or Gnosis Safe are not allowed.
withoutBoost: Without boosting, the vesting end date will be the longest among your locks.
ARVConversionBanner: Conversion 100 DOUGH = 1 AUXO, see the next step for details
PRVConversionBanner: Conversion 100 DOUGH = 1 AUXO, see the next step for details
DOUGHtoAUXO: DOUGH will be converted to AUXO at 100:1 rate (ex. ‚Äú‚Äù)
AUXOtoArvPrv: You choose whether to receive ARV or PRV
faq1Answer:
We're migrating locked DOUGH to locked AUXO. You will be able to choose to lock AUXO as ARV or PRV. Only veDOUGH holders will be able to migrate their DOUGH locks to ARV or PRV.

‚ö†Ô∏è If you're looking for options for DOUGH, or eDOUGH please go to https://piedaoorg.on.fleek.co/#/buyback
faq2: What are the differences between veDOUGH and ARV staking?
faq2Answer:
The main difference is that, with veDOUGH, users can have multiple locks in the same wallet.

  • veDOUGH locks are created when somebody stakes DOUGH for veDOUGH, and expire at a certain point in time. Staking multiple times creates multiple locks, with separate expiry dates.
  • ARV has a single-lock mechanism. All ARV locked by the user will expire at the same time. Additional locked AUXO can be added, and unless specified, this will expire at the same time as existing ARV.
faq3: What‚Äôs the difference between ARV  and PRV?
faq3Answer:
• Choose ARV if you are willing to commit to active governance while receiving the highest possible returns (rewards).
  • Choose PRV if you are willing to be passive on governance by holding a governance free and transferable asset.
ARV is a non-transferable asset that will allow you to get monthly rewards for governing the DAO. It receives 70% of rewards, can be redeemed for AUXO after the lock expiration, and has the option to exit to PRV by paying a 20% early lock termintaion fee. Rewards are distributed on a monthly basis to active holders (who voted during the previous month). The amount will be subject to a level system that boosts the rewards of those with longer expiration dates ‚Äî levels decay on a monthly basis, and should be boosted periodically to maximize the rewards received.PRV is a transferable asset that will allow you to get monthly rewards while being free from governance obligations. PRV requires to be staked for an entire epoch to qualify for monthly rewards distribution. 30% of the Treasury Farming will be distributed monthly as rewards to all qualifying PRV. The ARV‚ÜíPRV conversion is irreversible, but PRV can be withdrawn for AUXO (subject to budget availability and a fee).
faq4Answer:
Option 1: Migrate all your DOUGH locks (aggregate) to one single lock to either ARV or PRV.

Option 2: Migrate your DOUGH locks to either ARV or PRV one by one to individual addresses.

Option 3: Combination of the above (single lock/s to ARV and aggregate the remaining to PRV, or vice versa)

Notes:(a) You can choose to boost your lock to MAX (36 months) only when aggregating ARV locks ‚Äî which will also reset your lock start date and gives you the best AUXO:ARV ratio.(b) Aggregation can only be done in the wallet that holds the DOUGH locks ‚Äî this is true for ARV and PRV.(c) Single locking for ARV will be possible only on wallets with no DOUGH or AUXO locks.(d) Single locks are migrated in an order determined by the contract: longest locks first.(e) The same wallet can hold ARV and PRV.
faq5Answer:
Aggregate & Boost: You can choose to boost your lock to MAX (36 months) only when aggregating ARV locks ‚Äî which will also reset your lock start date and gives you the best AUXO:ARV ratio.

Aggregate: Aggregation can only be done in the wallet that holds the DOUGH locks ‚Äî this is true for ARV and PRV.

Locks Destination: The same wallet can hold ARV and PRV.

Single Locks Destination: Single locking for ARV will be possible only on wallets with no DOUGH or AUXO locks.

Single Locking Order: Single locks are migrated in an order determined by the contract: longest locks first.
faq6: What happens if I aggregate all locks?
faq6Answer:
All your DOUGH locks will be merged into one single lock. For ARV, the new lock duration will be determined by the remaining time to expiration of your longest DOUGH lock, starting from a minimum of 6 months (amount of months until expiration date) ‚Äî impacting the amount of ARV received. The end date will be derived from adding the new lock‚Äôs duration to the date you migrated. In case you decide to boost your lock, you will be locking for 36 months and updating the start date to the transaction date: in such case, the amount of ARV will be 1:1 with the amount of locked AUXO, and you‚Äôll start your lock with the highest rewards level: 30.

Examples:(a) You choose to migrate to ARV aggregating your locks without boosting. Let‚Äôs consider your longest lock has 10 months left for expiration. Your new lock in this case will equal to locking AUXO in a new single lock for 10 months and the amount of ARV received would be subject to the staking curve for a 10 months commitment, while your rewards level will be 4.(b) You choose to migrate to ARV aggregating your locks and boosting. Let‚Äôs consider your longest lock to have 10 months left for expiration. Your new lock in this case will result in locking AUXO in a new single lock for 36 months with a reset in the start date and the amount of ARV received would be equal to locking AUXO for 36 months. In this case your rewards level will be 30.(c) You choose to migrate to PRV aggregating your locks. The DOUGH on your locks will be migrated to AUXO (100:1 ratio), and you will receive an amount of PRV equal to the amount of AUXO deposited (1:1 AUXO:PRV ratio).
faq7: What happens if I migrate locks individually?
faq7Answer:
Migrating locks individually will allow you to move each lock to a new wallet (1 lock, 1 wallet) ‚Äî the destination wallets should not hold any locks. You can choose to migrate 1 lock to your DOUGH lock holding address, or individual locks to different addresses.

Note: Only 1 ARV lock per address is allowed. If your wallet holds multiple locks and you migrate only one to ARV on it you will not be able to aggregate the rest to ARV anymore on it ‚Äî the remaining locks will either need to be migrated to other wallets, migrated to PRV or remain as veDOUGH.
faq8: What are the implications of picking the current vs new wallet?
faq8Answer:
• Aggregating ARV ‚Üí Allowed only in the same wallet ‚Äî Not possible if it holds an ARV lock, but possible if it holds a PRV lock.
  • Single ARV locks ‚Üí Allowed in the same or a new wallet ‚Äî Can co-exist with a PRV lock in either. Not possible to aggregate ARV at a later stage in the same wallet if a new single lock is created.
  • Aggregating PRV ‚Üí Allowed only in the same wallet ‚Äî Possible if it holds other PRV or even an ARV lock.
  • Single PRV lock ‚Üí Allowed in the same or a new wallet ‚Äî Can co-exist with other PRV locks in either and aggregate in the same wallet.
faq9: My locks expire next month, why can I only stake them for 6 months?
faq9Answer: The duration of non-boosted locks migrated to ARV is determined by the remaining time to expiration of your longest vDOUGH lock (amount of months until its expiration date). Yet, if the number of months is lower than the minimum lock time (6 months), then your new lock will be automatically set to the 6 months minimum.
faq10: I made a mistake and chose the incorrect option, can I revert?
faq10Answer: You cannot, so don‚Äôt rush your decision. You can always reach out on Discord for assistance.
faq11: Why is my veDOUGH balance greater than the resulting ARV?
faq11Answer:
The migration is about moving your locked DOUGH to AUXO, and then staking AUXO for either ARV or PRV. During that process, there‚Äôre three ratios that apply:

  • DOUGH:AUXO ratio:The DOUGH to AUXO conversion is set at 100:1. This has been set in order to define the AUXO supply and to factor in the DOUGH supply after completing the burning of the Treasury-owned DOUGH.
  • AUXO:ARV ratio:The amount of ARV received by staking AUXO is determined by two elements: the locked amount and the time commitment (6 to 36 months), following the curve: y=x/k*log(x) ‚Äî the same mechanic that DOUGH:veDOUGH had.
  • AUXO:PRV ratio:The AUXO:PRV ratio is 1:1, as no curve or decay applies.
faq12: I have questions...a lot. Where can I go?
faq12Answer: Join us at Discord and it will be taken care of
faq13: What happens if I don't migrate on time?
faq13Answer:
Your remaining locked DOUGH will be unlocked, and you will be able to claim it. There won't be future migrations.

‚ö†Ô∏è If you don't migrate by April 2023 (to be ratified) you won't be able to migrate at all!
faq14: What will happen to any DOUGH after the migration?
faq14Answer: DOUGH will always be with us ‚Äî yet it won‚Äôt serve any purpose in the Auxo DAO. DOUGH won‚Äôt be migrated, and its utility and liquidity provisioning will be halted by the time the migration starts. Holders will be able to trade it as long as there‚Äôs a secondary market for it, or through the Buyback initiative (Epoch#10). Any secondary market will neither be promoted nor supported by the DAO though.
faq15: I‚Äôm a veDOUGH holder, and I want out. What can I do?
faq15Answer: After the migration DOUGH will be unlocked and available for claiming.
faq16Answer: Every month the DAO Treasury will distribute rewards to ARV and PRV stakers that come from the Treasury Farming operations. Both ARV and PRV holders will receive rewards, but the ARV rewards distributed per token will be higher than the PRV rewards per token. 70% of the Treasury Farming will be distributed monthly as rewards to the ARV vault, while 30% to the PRV vault.
faq17Answer: ARV token holders will benefit from direct on-chain/off-chain governance capabilities and their share will enable them to vote and govern the DAO. For ARV holders voting is an action required to be eligible for the monthly rewards distribution. On the other hand, PRV holders delegate the governance work to the ARV holders. Instead of voting, PRV holders require to stake their tokens in order to be eligible for the monthly (epoch) rewards distribution.
faq18Answer: ARV is a non-transferable token, meaning that it will stay in the wallet chosen until the lock is over and can be unlocked and redeemed for AUXO. In comparison, PRV is a transferable token that can be transferred freely.
faq19Answer:
AUXO holders choosing to stake to ARV will be able to select a lock period between 6 and 36 months, and once locked can opt-in to boost their position‚Äôs level to maximize their rewards. Once the lock expires ARV holders can redeem their tokens getting back AUXO. veDOUGH holders choosing to migrate to PRV will be locking AUXO until they decide to withdraw it for AUXO by paying a fee or selling it in secondary markets‚Äî withdrawal will be done in batches and is subject to budget availability. PRV withdrawal budget is defined per epoch and is derived from Auxo‚Äôs price premium versus the treasury net asset value.

IF AUXO Price = premium, THEN 'Redemption budget' > '$0', else (Discount or NAV), $0
faq20Answer: AUXO introduces a way for ARV holders to create recurring liquidity events, also known as Bonding, in order to increase treasury principal by minting tokens. Bonding to ARV and PRV always happens at the exact NAV (Net Asset Value).
faq21Answer:
The Auxo DAO mechanisms will contemplate the following fees:

  • 20% early termination fee when exiting from ARV->PRV
  • 1 level/mo decay over ARV Rewards
faq22Answer: ARV holders can only exit at lock expiration. PRV holders can exit by paying a withdrawal fee or trading in secondary markets. At any given point in time, ARV can be migrated to PRV by having applied a 20% early termination fee, allowing PRV to then be traded to exit the position.
